URLCanParse_static.summary: The URL.canParse() static method of the interface returns a boolean indicating whether or not an absolute URL, or a relative URL combined with a base URL, are parsable and valid.

remarks.para:
This a fast and easy alternative to constructing a URL within a try...catch block.
It returns true for the same values for which the URL() constructor would succeed, and false for the values that would cause the constructor to throw.

-
-A polyfill of URL.canParse() is available in core-js

URLCanParse_static.returns: true if the URL can be parsed and is valid; false otherwise.
